Welcome to rdlEngine’s documentation!¶

type FontSet¶
A font set may contain four fonths each providing different types of glyphs

symbols: ascii range 33 to 47 numeric: ascii range 48 to 57 upper: ascii range 65 to 90 lower: ascii range 97 to 122

list_entry(ptr, type, member)

list_entry - get the struct for this entry @ptr: the &List pointer. @type: the type of the struct this is embedded in. @member: the name of the list_head within the struct.

list_for_each(pos, head)

list_for_each - iterate over a list @pos: the &List to use as a loop cursor. @head: the head for your list.

type SpritePattern¶
spr_pattern_set:

a set of sprite patterns plus data used for animation

type SpriteDef¶
spr_sprite_def:

copy of sprite attributes as in vram plus animation status

void map_inflate(const int *dict, int *in, int *out, int data_size, int w)¶
read a buffer an expand it using a 4x4 tile dictionary

this provides a fixed ratio of 1/4 and decompression buffer size is fixed.

width of the map is needed out buffer needs to be 4 times data_size

void __map_inflate_screen(const int *dict, int *in, int *out, int w, int vpx, int vpy)¶

Inflate only a 32x24 window of the map to a buffer, useful if the map is too big to be decompressed entirely.

check collisions every X frames *

set callbacks for specific tiles

Sets all the tiles composing an object as coliding tiles

registers tiles from a plain tile_set as colliding

TILE_WIDTH¶

Set a tile that collides only when falling

Update dpo collision_state

truncate tile positions to screen borders *

and add logic to handle corner cases *

check non-blocking collisions *

compute tile colision based on future position XXX: Enemies do not trigger collision callbacks with tob, need a flag.

bitmap_find_gap:

find a sequence of n 1s in the bitmap

void spr_init()¶

spr_init: initialize vdp sprites and allocation tables

entirely disable sprites by setting y=208 *

int spr_valloc_pattern_set()¶
spr_valloc_pattern_set:

finds a gap to allocate a pattern set

spr_show: finds a gap to allocate the attribute set

set sprite outside screen using EC bit

Set sprite position taking into account off-screen coordinates

Handle sprite animation for simple cases of 2 and 4 states with collision

void replay_route()¶
replay_route:

output data to PSG

void replay_decode_data()¶
replay_decode_data:

process the pattern data

void tile_set_to_vram_bank(int *ts, int bank, int pos)¶

set a tileset in a fixed position.

int tile_set_valloc()¶
tile_set_valloc

attemps to allocate vram for a tileset

params: return: true if success, false if failure

void tile_set_to_vram(int *ts, int pos)¶
Force a tileset into a certain position

this is useful when we have a map whose tiles are static and depend on the tiles to be in a specific location.

puts on a screen buffer a set of tiles using an already allocated tileset

allow for shift using idx: this will only work for single frame one direction objects *

Handle sprite animation for simple cases of 2 and 4 states with collision

list_add - add a new entry @new: new entry to be added @head: list head to add it after

Insert a new entry after the specified head. This is good for implementing stacks.

list_del - deletes entry from list. @entry: the element to delete from the list. Note: list_empty() on entry does not return true after this, the entry is in an undefined state.

void font_to_vram(int *f, int pos)¶
void font_to_vram_bank(int *f, int bank, int pos)¶

Uploads a font to vram

void font_color_mask(int *f, int color)¶

Applies a color mask to a font already allocated in vram

void font_set_color_mask(int *fs, int color)¶

Apply color mask to a font set already allocated in vram

void font_printf(int *fs, int x, int y, int *buffer, char *text)¶

print a complex string to a buffer using a font_set

void font_vprintf(int *fs, int x, int y, char *text)¶

prints a complex string directly to vram

copy ram buffer to vram

Fills name table with zeros and define zero char color in all banks

Writes a string to vram assuming scr2 and default character set is defined

send a char to the debug port

log

debug log trough printer port, useful when running in openmsx

sys_irq_register:

register a function to be run from the interrupt handler any registered caller must run with _interrupts disabled_

sys_irq_unregister

sys_irq_handler:

irq handler using

sys_irq_init

register irq handler using BIOS hook

sys_sleep_ms

FIXME: currently can sleep a max of 1000ms

LFSR RNG
